docTitle.titlePart:
Einfluß von Substituenten auf die Fluoreszenzquantenausbeute
bei Donator-Akzeptor-substituierten trans-Stilbenen *

byline.docAuthor: D. Gloyna **, A. Kawski und I. Gryczynski

titlePage.byline: Lumineszenz-Forschungsgruppe , Institut für Physik der Universität Gdansk, Gdansk , Polen

front.note: Influence of Substüuents on Fluorescence Quantum Yields of Donor-Acceptor-Substüuted-trans - Stilbene8
front.div:
For 4'-acceptor substituted 4-dimethylaminostilbenes 1 the fluorescence quantum yield tpt
increases in n-heptane and toluene with decreasing acceptor interaction ( i.e. with decreasing
polarity in the Sx-state ). At the same time, the lifetimes Tf w change with q % so that k^ remains
approximately constant. Changes in pt for compounds 1 result from a strong change of the rate
constant t p of radiationless deactivation. This is interpreted in terms of the decreased stabiliza-
tion of the Si-state occurring with the increase in the polarity of the investigated compounds
in non-polar solvents, and remains in good agreement with the calculations carried out previously.
